An Unfinished Idea: A Conference On Emerging Programming Languages

An event to bring together bright folks working on unfinished or recently finished programming languages. Even relatively young languages like Scala would not qualify; this event is all about the sharpest part of the cutting edge.

People working on emerging languages:

  • Ola Bini (Ioke")
  • Steve Dekorte (assuming he starts working on his post-Io language)
  • members of the Axum team
  • Adam Chlipala (Ur)
  • Tony Arcieri (Reia)
  • why the lucky stiff (Potion)
  • members of the AmbientTalk team
  • Chuck Esterbrook (Cobra) – [is the language too old?]
  • Jeff Prothero (Mythryl)
  • Gilad Bracha (Newspeak)
  • members of the Fan team
  • Philip Mercurio (Thyrd)
  • Giancarlo Niccolai (Falcon)
  • Amos Wenger (ooc)
  • members of the Cappuccino/Objective-J team
  • members of the COLA team
  • Robert Virding (Lisp Flavored Erlang)
  • members of the Trylon team
  • members of the Snow team
  • members of the Noop team

It makes sense to schedule the event around JavaOne or another large conference that attracts language-minded developers. The event would likely be held in San Francisco, and would be a single day (including a planned outing in the evening). Target date is mid-2010.

—Jun 15, 2009
